title: Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park: Self Guided Walking Tours
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Self Guided Walking Tours               Self Guided Walking Tours       One of the great things about visiting the Blackstone River Valley is you can just go off and explore the area on your own, at your own pace. Sometimes the best way to really get the feel for the park is to just take a walk through one of the villages and see how they all tie together around the mill and the river. But if you like to have a little bit of guidance on your journey, please click on the links below for a self guided tour through the sites of the Blackstone River Valley.  Â              From commune to factory town Hopedale Self Guided Tour   Hopedale began as a commune and grew into the home of the largest loom manufacturer in America          Making the Machines Whitinsville Walking Tour   The Whitin Machine Works made machines for textile mills across the Blackstone Valley and around the world.          America's First Mill Village Slatersville Walking Tour   Slatersville is the first planned mill village in America, and the blueprint for the other villages of the Blackstone Valley
